revised_title: Bending, Buckling, and Curling of Heated Elliptical Plates
tldr: This article presents a large-deflexion analysis of an elliptical plate of lenticular section with varying thickness and temperature. The study explores the bending, buckling, and curling behavior of the plate under a uniform temperature gradient through its thickness. The research provides insights into the preferred direction of curling, asymmetrical buckling, and snap-through buckling, as well as the effects of initial principal curvatures and temperature gradients on the plate's behavior.
